thread.title: Kristen Stewart made a very low-key appearance at the Tommy Hilfiger show to support Stella Maxwell
thread.title_full: Kristen Stewart made a very low-key appearance at the Tommy Hilfiger show to support Stella Maxwell

author: Krista Jensen
title: Kristen Stewart made a very low-key appearance at the Tommy Hilfiger show to support Stella Maxwell
text:
Kristen Stewart made a very low-key appearance at the Tommy Hilfiger show to support Stella Maxwell We love a sweet, new, supportive Hollywood relationship, especially when both partners are easy on the eyes. This is why we’re giddy to see pics of Kristen Stewart casually attending the Tommy Hilfiger fashion show to support ~rumored~ girlfriend Stella Maxwell this week. Stella, who is a freakin’ Victoria’s Secret angel , walked in the high-profile show alongside the Hadid sisters and Hailey Baldwin. Lady Gaga was there, too, and yes, she wore a new version of her cool catwoman face mask makeup from the Superbowl . More on that some other time.
A photo posted by Just Jared Jr. (@justjaredjr) on Feb 7, 2017 at 9:13am PST 
The actress, fresh off her f-bomb drop on this past weekend’s SNL, smiled and watched her girlfriend wow the crowd in a cropped red polo with patches and some stripey kickflares in blue stripes. The whole show was very ’90s Tommy reminiscent, which has got us reaching for our old makeup drawers to see if we still have a spritz of Tommy Girl left.
Frazer Harrison / Getty Images for Tommy Hilfiger The big buckle, the long blonde highlighted beach hair. Wait — were we supposed to keep that Tommy gear from 1996? Judging by the bandana and denim-banded wristwatch, the answer is yes.
Frazer Harrison / Getty Images for Tommy Hilfiger Kristen rolled up in a black fitted hoodie and some black skinnies (and a Sprite?), eager to let the spotlight be only on Stella. That’s the key to a great relationship, everybody. Balance!
gotpap / Star Max / GC Images / Getty Images If you ask us, Kristen’s always had a type of chill Kate Mossian ’90s model vibe. She doesn’t give an eff about most things, and the ones she does give an eff about really truly matter. *cough* Stella, we think that’s you.
